attributes.action: REDUNDANCY JOB SEEKERS ALLOWANCE AND PRESCRPTIONS
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
There is currently two different versions of Job seekers allowance
Firstly Income based.If you on this system you will be award free prescriptions although no national health NI contrutions have been paid by the claiment. 
Secondly the Contribution based JSA. The people coming under this heading are not given free prescriptions, 
although whilst they were employed they have paid NI contributions. It has to be deamned as being unfair that the people who have paid into NI are not given free prescriptions, whilst those who have not paid contributions are given the prescriptions Free of charge.
e.g If a person is made redundant from employement and paid NI, the person is not given free prescrptions,

Please would you undersign below if you agree that the current system is unfair

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
